para.text: This shows how to reproduce the second example from the SUTRA 4.0 documentation where a more complete description of the model can be found. In it, an unsaturated profile model with 100 elements in the vertical direction and one element in the X direction is subjected to freezing and thawing. The model has two parts. In the first part, freezing occurs from the top down. In the second part, thawing occurs from the bottom up due to upward groundwater flow.

Start the ModelMuse and select a 2D profile model in which Freezing transport and unsaturated flow are selected. The model will be two meters tall and one meter wide so select the model area to encompass the a rectangle extending from (0,0) to (1,2). Select Mesh|Draw Fishnet Mesh Quadrilaaterals and draw a quadrilateral covering the model area. You can type in exact coordinates after finishing drawing the fishnet mesh quadrilateral. When done specify 100 elements in the vertical direction and 1 element in the X direction. Then select

image.title: Screen capture of ModelMuse showing the model specifications
image.caption: Screen capture of ModelMuse showing the model specifications

image.title: Screen capture showing to corner coordinates of the fishnet mesh quadrilateral.
image.caption: Screen capture showing to corner coordinates of the fishnet mesh quadrilateral.

para.text: Several changes need to be made in the SUTRA Options dialog box. Select

li.text: pane, specify SUTRA 4.0 - Unsaturated Freeze/Thaw Example - Part A, Freezing of unsaturated unfrozen column starting at top.

image.title: Screen capture of the Total Water Saturation tab for Region 1 with selected choices highlighted.
image.caption: Screen capture of the Total Water Saturation tab for Region 1 with selected choices highlighted.

para.text: Two time schedules are used for the model. Select

image.title: Screen capture of the SUTRA Time Controls dialog box illustrating the specification of the TIME_STEPS schedule.
image.caption: Screen capture of the SUTRA Time Controls dialog box illustrating the specification of the TIME_STEPS schedule.

para.text: Click the Add time schedule button to add a new time schedule. Set the

image.title: Screen capture of the SUTRA Time Controls dialog box showing the specificatin of the Time_Obs schedule.
image.caption: Screen capture of the SUTRA Time Controls dialog box showing the specificatin of the Time_Obs schedule.

para.text: . On the Listing File pane, set NPRINT to 10. On the Nod and Ele Files pane, NCOLPR and LCOLPR to 10 and check the check boxes for liquid saturation and ice saturation.

Initially, the column is fully unsaturated with a pressure of 0 at the bottom and -19,620 at the top. This can be specified with the default formula of Interpolate(Y, 0., 0., -19620., 2.) for the InitialPressure data set. The initial temperature is 2. The longitudinal dispersivity is 0.01. The maximum permeability is 5E-12. The porosity is 0.3. The transverse dispersivity is 0.01. The default formulas for the other data sets can be left unchanged.

image.title: Screen capture of the Data Sets dialog box highlighting the data sets whose formulas need to be edited and the formula for the InitialPressure data set.
image.caption: Screen capture of the Data Sets dialog box highlighting the data sets whose formulas need to be edited and the formula for the InitialPressure data set.

para.text: All the boundary conditions use TIME_STEPS as their schedule. At the bottom of the column there are specified pressure, temperature, and fluid flux boundaries. Use a straight-line object drawn through the mesh at the lowest nodes to specify them. The specified pressure is 0 with an associated temperature of 2. The specified temperature is also 2. The fluid flux rate is 0 with an associated temperature of 2. (The Fluid flux boundary will be set to a non-zero value in the second part of the exercise.Use another straight-line object to define a specified temperature boundary and generalized flow boundary at the top of the mesh. The specified temperature is -8. For the generalized flow boundary, set

image.title: Screen capture of Object Properties dialog box showing the specification of a generalized flow boundary.
image.caption: Screen capture of Object Properties dialog box showing the specification of a generalized flow boundary.

para.text: The entire left column of the model will be used for observations to enable plotting of graphs of aquifer properties. Use Timed_Obs as the time schedule. Set the observation format to OBC.

image.title: Screen capture of the Object Properties dialog box showing specification of observation times.
image.caption: Screen capture of the Object Properties dialog box showing specification of observation times.

para.text: Export the SUTRA input files and run the model. The restart file from this model will be used to specify the starting conditions for the second part of the model in which thawing conditions are simulated.
Save your model with a new name for part B of this exercise in which thawing is simulated.
Many of the SUTRA options will remain the same but a few are changed.
pane, change the title to "SUTRA 4.0 - Unsaturated Freeze/Thaw Example - Part B (continued from Part A), Thawing of unsaturated partially frozen column due to water inflow at bottom"
pane, choose to use the restart file for both the initial pressure and temperature and then select the restart file from part A
pane, check the check box to simulate production.

image.caption: Screen capture of the SUTRA Options dialog box showing that the restart file is used for the initial conditions.

para.text: dialog box for the TIME_STEPS schedule, change
to 9,999,999. For the Timed_Obs schedule, change NSMAX to 18001, ISTEPL to 45,000, and ISSTEPC to 100.
In the SUTRA Output Control dialog box, change
to 100. For the observation and boundary condition files, increase all the values except NOBLIN from 9999 tp 99999

For the bottom boundary, deactivate the specified pressure boundary, Change the starting time of the specified temperature and fluid flux boundaries to 864. Change the fluid flux rate to 5.787037037E-5. For the top boundary, deactivate the fluid flux boundary.

After running the model, you can import the simulated values to obtain figures similar to those in the SUTRA 4.0 documentation. The data in the observation output files (.obc) files can be imported into spreadsheets and plotted to produce graphs similar to those in the SUTRA 4.0 documentation.
